text: Service is slow! Don't bother coming here if you want to be fed. A couple of people were waiting and no one came to even get our drink order. It's not a big place so I don't know what the problem was. Really sad as I was looking forward to eating there.

I just ate a delicious, homey, perfectly-balanced bowl of (hot) pork green curry...hot to burn the lips but not the stomach...the lime leaf overwhelms your taste and smell...and the warm, light and creamy spoonful of mouthwatering heat only gets better as you bite down on crisp and delicious strips of bamboo shoot and sweet red pepper...and I got that (to go) at GAATI.  Given that last review (errata: plug), however, I can't wait to try Penn's on Sunset!   I will complain that I got NO spiders (not even a single cricket!) with my meal as I always do.  I mean, is this place ridiculous for not being what I expect a Thai place to be!!?? If not perfect, Gaati is pleasant and spotless.  I love their (AUTHENTIC) food, come here often and appreciate having it around.  So it's OK that one may like Penn's (and give it not one, but two, lengthy and STELLAR reviews...and wished there were more stars?), but I contest (apparently malicious) bug statements (unless some Spring fluke?).  Everyone is entitled to an opinion but some just aim to hurt...and if I agreed, we'd both be wrong.  I can't have enough good Thai food to eat (and I'm an awesome, AWESOME critic of Thai food)....so at least I would follow someone's advice for Penn's... "Tip: If you have been here ONCE and maybe not had a five star experience, please give them another shot."  I bet those designs they make from straws really make one feel like "family".  If we can't be fair, maybe we SHOULD take our asses back to Applebee's.

Gentlemen button up your shirts and leave the skanks at home, this place is for romance. I like the upscale look but its missing the Thai look. Order was wrong all ready for the first course but instantly taken care care before I could finish typing this sentence. The vegetable egg roll was delicious. The sesame toast is really good! The chicken wonton soup had to much of a beefy taste for me.

It's our second time coming here and we will keep coming.  We started with the chicken Tum yum and chicken egg roll. Both were perfect in flavor, level of spice.  The main course we ordered was the pad thai and panang curry.  Both again were perfect!   Not only is the food good but the service is amazing.  Oh yeah try the homemade ice cream.

This place is awesome! The staff is super friendly and the food is great. I've been here a few times and every time the food I have ordered has been fresh, delicious and up to standards. The tom yum soup is to die for.

I would recommend the pad thai to anyone! I never likes thai food until I tries Gaati! I would eat here every week if I lived closer. The service is friendly and the food is great! I am glad I found this place!

Takes a lot for me to write a review. I just couldn't let this one go, again! Chicken pad Thai was awful! Twice! Not sure if it's a new cook or what. It lacked flavor and quality. Mongolian beef was not much better. When I first moved here I thought I found a gem. After being here a year and ordering take out several times. I'll never go back. Bummer!

Entering Gaati Thai was a wonderful surprise!  The exterior is a standard shopping center but the interior of the restaurant is elegant in a very comfortable way (lovely but jeans are completely appropriate)... a great place to meet friends, have a quick dinner on a busy night or even go on a date.  Everyone I have taken to Gaati has loved it, too!  The food is excellent, portions are just right and the hot pot soup is not to be missed.

We were disappointed in this new place.  The decor is nice but the food is not good.  We had the yellow curry and it seemed like they left out the coconut milk.  Even the Pad Thai was not great.  They made our kids eat off of paper plates.  And the food is WAY over priced.  I give this place 3 months at best.  Disappointed.

Up in Vegas for our daughter's 21st birthday and hoped for a tasty Thai meal on a quiet evening as we wait for all the revelers to fly in the following day.    The meal was outstanding.  Fabulous phad kee mao and equally delicious lemongrass chicken.  Fresh prepared,  incredible play of flavors.  Would love to have this restaurant at home on Scottsdale.  Now we need an excuse to come back to Vegas. Don't forget to try their homemade ice cream.  Recommend thai iced tea ice cream and the coconut ice cream.  Yum.

Great place hidden away in Henderson. They made an appetizer combo for us and WOW. All homemade and great. The Panang Curry was like heaven on earth. Our table also shared Pad Thai and Pad See Ew medium spicy, both great. The homemade Coconut ice cream another special treat. Can't wait to go back and try the Crab Fried Rice. The table next to us had it and said it wasn't to be missed. The staff was so friendly too!!!   Thanks Gaati!!
Had the lunch special.. the food was fresh and very tasteful. I have been a fan and client of the owners of this restaurant.  So happy to have them near my office

We came here about a month after they opened.  The place was clean and the decor was very tasteful.  The staff was nice, but the food was just awful.  Perhaps we are spoiled by being from Seattle, where some of the best Thai food in the country is available.   Anyways, to continue this short review of Gaati . . .   We always start our test of a new Thai restaurant by ordering two dishes:  Tom Kah Gai and Chicken Pad Thai.  Here, the Chicken Pad Thai was greasy, burnt, oily and salty..    The Tom Kah Gai was awful.  They used milk or cream in it, which does not belong in this dish normally made with coconut milk.  Not only did it have milk or cream in it, but it  had actually curdled!. It was nauseating.  We suspect the cook had some semantic confusion between the word "milk" in coconut milk and actual milk.    We didn't finish the food and never went back.  We were very disappointed.
I think this place is totally great!! The ambiance is really chill. The food was probably some of the best Thai food I've ever had in the Vegas area. This place is an absolute must!!!!

Best Thai food in Vegas. Price outside of lunch specials is a little on the higher end but if you are spending money going out, it is well worth the few extra bucks. Service is excellent and they are accommodating to vegetarians. No surprise fish sauce here! If you have not tried this place you are missing out.

I lived in Thailand for 2 years, and I'm pretty Thai-food snobby.  So far this has been the only Thai place I've liked in the Henderson/Vegas area.  Soups and grilled foods are authentic.  Great wine list, especially for a Thai restaurant.

We ordered our food and drinks. The waiter didn't even have a pen and paper to write our order. When he delivered our beer and poured into the glass . Beer bubbles all over the glass. I told him let me show you how to pour beer correctly. If you're selling beer you should know how to pour beer correctly with no beer bubbles all over! I really don't like to drink my cold beer with all the bubbles. If I am ordering beer on tap then that's totally different. Then our order came in differently with what we expected. The waiter didn't even explained to us that there are two of the same name but different style of preparation. How would the customer know that they have two different style of preparation with same name . So when the food was delivered I was looking for the noodles and he said we ordered the soup. So I said my hubby even pointed out to you what he wanted and you still gave us something different . He should have explained and told Us that we ordered the  soup and not the noodles . The customer won't know that you guys have two of the same name but different preparation.  Will never go back because the waiter insisted that we were the ones that ordered the wrong food.  Had he explained to us we should have known that they have two of the same name but different preparation. Then thats totally another thing.  Super frustrated. But since there's a lot of thai restaurant in the neighborhood why go back to this one when they won't even admit their mistakes!  Not that I wanted to get a free meal! All I wanted to hear is for him to say "so sorry my mistake" but he still insisted that it was our mistake. Even though I told him you should have advised us that they have two of the same name but different preparations. But nope he didn't !!!  Well the food sucks anyway . The soup was very very sweet. Taste like I ordered a desert. Not authentic thai soup. I never tasted sweet soup from any thai restaurant I have been and even when we travelled in Thailand. We didn't order a desert soup!  Longest review ever!! should be helpful for everyone!

Great food, great customer service, and great atmosphere! What more can you ask for.? They even have young coconut which is my favorite beverage to have with Thai food. I will be frequently this place often and recommending it to everyone I know.

I've gone two times and have had two awesome experiences. The interior is modern and simple, just an overall calm ambience. Food was awesome, the first time around we ordered dinner with the family, Basil Fried Rice was rocking and the Massaman Curry was delicious as well. We started off with some simple Wonton Soup, which was also really pleasant and great for sharing between the four of us.   Second time I went was for the lunch special with my wife. Started with the soup which was incredible (don't remember the name, but it was a coconut base) and followed up with a curry that was also delicious. Five stars all around.   Follow it up with the coconut ice cream, it's got bits of jack fruit. Bomb.

Amazing food, great service. Enjoy from appetizers to dessert :)   The interior is amazing, Great for a quite date, Small but cozy,   I get out here at least once a month or everyother month to try a new dish.

Food and service was fast. I found the prices to be good, and you get a lot of food.  The Rangoon was fantastic the outside was a little over cooked but it's all about the creamy inside with this dish anyways.  Ordered Pad Thai because it you can't make this right then you have no right claiming to be a Thai Restaurant.  And I'm pleased to say that it was delicious... although not the best I've had.  Also we ordered Ladd na.  Was stated as being really good.  And massa curry was also one of the best we've had.

I love this place a lot. I came in with my friend today  and tried theirs shrimp crab rangoon and pineapple meatball for appetizer. OMG!! It was so good. It's a nice combination of flavor meatball and grill pineapple come with 2 skewers. We got crab fried rice and basil chicken for dinner and a bottle of lychee sake to drink. It was a chunk of real crabmeat for the fried rice.    The service : Very warm welcoming. The owner is from Thailand. She always recommend me theirs new menu every time she's there.   Very nice relaxing asmospear. I always order a bottle of wine, sitting sipping and enjoy very much everything!!!    I definitely would recommend this place to everybody that live in this area and anyone who drove by. :D

How nice to find a local Thai place that provides quality food, isn't greasy and has good variety. I wasn't as put off by the prices as some of the other reviewers. $11 seems to be the average price for the main courses. That's below many of the other local Thai restaurants in Henderson. The appetizer prices are a bit steeper ($8-$9) but the portion sizes were quite good.  Highlights: Appetizers - beef jerky (great cuts of beef, very little fat, tasty dipping sauce); curry puffs (not greasy at all, delicious sauce, I think we got 5-6 in our order which was more than we could eat.)  Salad - green papaya salad with shrimp. It's a standard. Perhaps a bit pricey for what you get but good flavor.  Mains - one penang curry with shrimp and one pad see ew. Both were good. I've found a lot of restaurants have oily pad see ew but this wasn't the case with ours. Penang curry was flavorful and had lots of shrimp.  Overall, quite pleased! We did take out but will gladly come again and dine in the restaurant.

Hubby and I had the War Won Ton and some glass noodles chicken dish, along with the 4 types of appetizers plate. The food was delicious! Not too salty, not too spicy, and served hot and fresh. Waitress was very kind and polite. Place is spotlessly clean, including restroom. We'd definitely come here again.
Consistently fresh and flavorful! Great ambiance and we order delivery once a week.
Their food taste horrible and the smallest portions EVER. Waste of money and waste of time.
The crispy rice is very crispy. But a bit so sour for me. The Tom yum and the fresh coconut juice is very nice.

I went there to try Thai food for the first time and i was very impressed. It was pretty busy but the food was worth it withount a doubt. I ordered a beef pad thai and it was enough to fill me up and even take the rest home. Their servers were very kind and helpful. 10/10 will be back!

I was out on business, and found myself here.  The food was great.  I had the curry puff, which was pretty good.  I'm a fan of cucumber relish with these, and there's was pretty good.  My main dish was Pad See Ew with Chicken.  By far my favorite, the noodles were firm and the sauce was perfect.  Atmosphere was pleasing, and definitely new.  A great place to try in my book.

Excellent Food! Family has had restaurants in Las Vegas over 30 years that we know of. We remember loving their 1st one on Tropicana. Now they're right here where we live in Henderson. Yea!  Gaati Thai Kitchen has Great food. Excellent soups. Restaurant is very clean with comfortable atmosphere. Sue will always help you order something you'll enjoy. We often order takeout and they deliver. Highly recommend.
My wife and I eat here all the time. We love it! Spicy basil chicken is a favorite of mine and my wife has been hooked on a coconut curry soup. Service is always good.

Thai Kitchen illuminated sign on wall?   Tinted windows?  Strip mall?   It can only meet low expectations, right?  It is fantastic. Excellent prices and portions for lunch & dinner. Nice, intimate  atmosphere (10 tables) that turns and burns. Full service, professional attitude, with a smile.  The chicken Pad See Ew was excellently presented with sweet soy sauce on top rich, flavorful rice noodles. The house soup is good by itself. The vegetables were perfectly cooked and the chicken was succulent. Laad Na, and Pad Kee Mao is as good or better than what I used to get at Natalie Thai in L.A., or NAGA here in Henderson...without the looooong waits. Plates were unchipped, silverware polished, and clean. Very impressed with the whole business.

Absolutely love this place!! GREAT attentive service, nice quiet ambiance and the best part is their food!!! Its been many years since we have found a our "go to restaurant" !!!! Just about anything we have ordered has been outstanding! It sits tucked away off of the main street but they still get plenty of traffic:) Their music is soft flowing and unobtrusive and easy listening!  Do give it a try!
Food was very flavorful and immense, service outstanding ! Overall great date or family restraunt !

Ordered the BBQ chicken and it was average tasting at the best but very dry. The portion was very large and the sauce was decent. I ordered pick-up and it was ready very quick and service was polite. I will give it another shot and try a different dish but will not be ordering the BBQ chicken again.

We went for a late lunch. The dining room was spic and span clean. I ordered the green curry with chicken and brown rice, it was excellent!  Fresh veggies and spicy curry. My husband ordered the pad Thai with pork, another excellent dish. We will be back again!

Food is delicious, yet overpriced. We've suggested this place to many of our friends and family. However, after today, I will not recommend this place to anyone ever again.   The service and employees lack customer service and competency. While placing an order for delivery over the phone, the employee was either high or an idiot, but he did not know how to spell, even while I was spelling out our address. Also, I had to constantly tell him, "Well....do you need my gate code? Do you need my payment information? Are you going to give us the total?" He was a buffoon! Not only that, but when I asked what our total was, he put us on hold for 10 minutes. I had to call from another phone, only to hear that employee say "I forgot they were on hold."  No amount of taste can make up for the horrible and incompetent staff. I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE.
There are tons of options for Thai food in Vegas. Unfortunately, not many good options. I've had the pleasure of eating here 3 times now. Good stuff and great service.
One of my favorite Thai Restaurants in Henderson.  Rivals some of the more known restaurants in the Las Vegas area. The owner is super friendly and the food is always fresh and delicious.

Wow, what a great new restaurant. Tried the veggies and tofu which was sooo good, I had to have it again the following day. Veggies perfectly done and tofu excellent.  First tried curry puffs and while I'm not a curry person, these were tasty and worth having again. Second time tried the chicken dumplings and again, so tasty and so worth the return visit. To die for?  Try the thai tea or coconut ice cream.  Good luck to this place.

Ordered lunch here today had it delivered ended up being the wrong order when I called the restaurant back and ask for Sue I was told she's no longer the owner they made it right when I got to my house it was horrible the worst Thai food I've ever eaten used to order here all the time never again

Ok so here is my second review of Gaati Thai. The first one I made was after eating there for the first time last night for dinner (amazing) and the second one is now after having my second meal there for lunch today with my wife. I want to start by stating that I am a chef and usually don't try a new restaurant for at least a few months after they open in order to give them an opportunity to work out the kinks. The restaurant industry is really a tough one and it usually takes a little time to get the staff and chef working in a smooth and homogeneous fashion but after dropping in last night to look at the menu I decided to try it and I couldn't be happier. For lunch today I wanted to try new dishes so we ordered Chicken Satay, Chicken Tom kha , Eggplant Entree and Crispy Pork belly. For dessert we tried the Pumpkin Custard. Here is the break down.   Satay was great. Flavor was really good and liked the peanut sauce.  My one criticism of this dish was that it came out of the kitchen warm and not hot.   The Tom kha was also Great but also a little on the warm side and could have been a little hotter. and it did have that curdled look also (I think that comes from using fresh coconut milk over the canned stuff)   The Eggplant was Fantastic, Tender, not greasy and the flavor was incredible.   The Crispy Pork Belly was flavor wise an 11 on a 1-10 scale but the pieces of pork Belly were on the smaller side so when fried to crisp them up suffered a little and came out a little dry (really just a little) but would benefit from being cut a little larger so that they remain tender and moist when being crisped up.   The Pumpkin custard was Sublime. Warm (in a good way) not to overly sweet like some Thai desserts can be.   Over all I want anyone interested in giving this place a try to know that they will really be trying out a special place. This is better than Lotus of Siam and I LOVE LOTUS OF SIAM. This Place has just been open for a little over a week and they are putting out amazing food. Cant wait to see what they will be serving in a few months.

Finally, a Thai restaurant that has nice ambience AND great food! We had the Gaati house soup (a bit bland, but otherwise nice and different), Thai beef salad (nice, a bit too much lime juice), pad thai (super flavor!, one of the best I've had in a while), and vegetables (great flavor also!) They also have brown rice (yes!). Overall, good portions and very tasty food. Best of all, and this is hard to find, the food wasn't too greasy. We'll definitely be back for more

Stopped in for lunch- our first Thai experience. We asked for some suggestions from the very friendly waitress! The food was great! Pad thai vegetables and basil chicken were delicious! Homemade coconut ice cream so good! Will definitely  go back and look forward to trying out the outside seating area!

I went to this place because Yelp had a good rating and this was closer to home than my usual Thai place.  What a disappointment!!!!  We had shrimp and chicken Pad Thai at our table and also green curry salmon.  We were the only people at a table at 5:30pm on a Wednesday, and that should have been my first clue.  In general, the flavors were good but the textures were terrible.  The pad thai was heavy and gummy and did not taste fresh.  The noodles had a good consistency if you could get past what covered them.  All of the vegetables in all of the dishes were overcooked and limp, especially the bok choy in the salmon dish.  The salmon, however, was cooked appropriately.  As has been said by others, the green curry was very, very, watery.  In fact it was thinner than the diet Coke I had with it.  The mix on their fountain machine was also not correct as there was little carbonation and a slightly acrid flavor.  To add insult to injury, two of us ordered our dishes spicy (they used a 1 to 4 scale), and they came back extremely mild.  When I looked at the final bill, it was clear the waiter did not put our spice level on the order for the two of us that ordered spicy, but did put it on one of the pad thais that was supposed to be mild.  That said, since we were the only ones at a table, the service was quick.  The owner's wife came out and asked if we needed anything, but she was so nice we didn't really want to tell her the truth.  Perhaps she'll read this review.  I cannot understand why the yelp rating of this place is so high.  I've noticed that recent ratings were somewhat low.  Perhaps this place has gone downhill....

This is the best Thai food in the Las Vegas area.  Their curries, especially the Panang, is  as good or better than any I've had around the world.  They are very willing to customize, to a point any of the menu items.  The staff is courteous and knowledgeable.  The restaurant is clean and comfortable.

I like this place.  It's close to my work so I walk there for lunch sometimes.  The service is friendly, very attentive, and fast!  Perfect for my lunch break.  I always get the green curry and it's fabulous!

Must say first that our food still has not arrived, so I can't review the actual food yet.  But, I cannot make this up.  We ordered delivery over an hour ago and the lady was so nice taking our order.  She called about 1 hour after ordering to tell apologize that her driver took the food out and "fell asleep".  I said that I have never heard of such a thing, what do you mean?  She said he works a night job and yeah he fell asleep.  If I wanted the food still, she could have it delivered though she said.  She is re-making it and said she would personally deliver it... crazy.

I was there for lunch with my husband today and was very pleased. The Tom Kha soup was a little too bland for me but the Tom Yum soup was better. We ordered the Spicy Mint Chicken and the Beef Green Curry, both were delicious. Will definitely come back.

We came here as part of a private party and had the best time! The service was top-notch, with the staff being attentive but not overbearing. The restaurant was clean and they even decorated for us with plenty of balloons and lights. Their meatballs are dynamite, and I could eat a whole bowl of their massaman curry- so fragrant and rich but not too heavy. Their Pad Thai was more mild than some and a bit sweet, but it worked well against some of the other spicy flavors. What a wonderful evening out!

Wonderful! The service was friendly, the ambience peaceful, and the food DELICIOUS!  The Thai iced tea was very refreshing, they give you a serving of sweet syrup on the side so you decide the sweetness, I really appreciated that. The soup was flavorful and had veggies from the first spoonful to the last. The chicken pad thai had plenty of chicken and the noodles were a perfect texture. The spice was lip- smacking good!  :)
Service is good. Food is tasty and have good portion to it. Price is fair. It's a hidden gem in Henderson
Amazing food! Truly authentic, fresh and extremely tasty! Love the atmosphere and the friendly service.

New owner alert! This place changed ownership in April 2014. We ordered the Pad Thai and the chicken satays. The peanut sauce for the satays was very runny and the pad Thai noodles were completely overlooked and greasy (also very little chicken or bean sprouts or peanuts to be found in this Pad Thai). For their prices and where they're located, the food needs to be improved in a big way.   If I want amazing Pad Thai I will need to go to Archi's or at the least, Pin Kaow. The first time we were here, the old owner made the food incredibly well and it was worth the price we paid. But now, it's just not very good.

My friends and I were recently celebrating a bachelorette party in Vegas, and instead of splurging at one of the uber expensive strip hotel restaurants, we decided to get Thai food delivered to Mandalay Bay - The Hotel.  It worked out perfectly--the food arrived as crispy and fresh as ever (chicken curry puffs and veggie egg rolls--oh my GAH *drool*), and we were able to play pre-party bachelorette games while chowing down!  The food was a hit with everyone.  If you want "Americanized" Thai, this place may be a bit different.  The food here is authentic, with dishes and flavors you might not find at mainstream Thai restaurants.  I'm from LA, where there's no shortage of Thai establishments, but having experienced the food here, I'm really sad we don't have a place like this in my hometown.  If you had a family member or friend in Thailand who happened to be an awesome chef, these are the types of dishes you could expect to find when invited over for dinner.  Just thinking about that meal now is making me hungry.  Gaati Thai Kitchen--come to Los Angeles!!

I LOVE Thai food! Gaati is really close to my new apt so I decided to try it. The staff are very friendly and attentive.  I've eaten there about half a dozen times now, wanted to make a educated review. The food is on the milder side, even when I have ordered it "Thai hot" (started with 2/4 on my first try... I've been burned before, so I've increasingly asked for hotter every time thereafter); maybe it's because I'm  a white guy. Aside from the level of spice/heat; everything has been of excellent quality, served very promptly (so food is hot in temperature and still crispy); between dishes I've ordered, as well as, the rest of my family, I've tried just about everything on the menu. Price is decent, not a bargain nor a rip off. Overall, I  recommend Gaati Thai Kitchen, just be aware that they base their level of spice on the average Anthem retiree.

Excellent lunch specials and menu, definitely worth going to for a Thai fix. The decor inside makes you completely forget you're in a strip mall, which is a nice touch. It's very convenient to get to and has ample parking.  The dinner menu doesn't offer anything substantially different than lunch, other than prices, but the food and service is good enough to warrant a solid 4 stars.  Their noodle dishes are fantastic, the curry is pretty good but not anything to rave about. I'm a huge curry fan so I'll take a good curry over a great noodle dish.

We've ordered takeout and delivery for over a year. Food is good, but ordered delivery tonight, and received a call 30 minutes later that the restaurant was full, and the kitchen could not fill the order. I asked could if they fill the order if I picked it up, and they could. I cancelled my order, and will not be ordering from them again. Can anyone recommend another Thai restaurant?

What I had: Roasted Duck and water (to drink)  Price: $20 + tax  The Good: The decor is decent.  The Bad: WAY TOO EXPENSIVE for what it is and what it tastes like. I ordered the duck as I was trying to test out the different places that actually served duck. The worst part is that the waitress there had no clue what she was talking about and couldn't even answer my simple questions. I asked her what size the duck was (a whole duck, half duck, or just a single duck breast) and she had to go to the kitchen to find out. She actually lied to me because she told me it was a half (of a whole duck). I got 1/2 a breast it seemed. Also, the duck was horrible. I tasted more like that cheap dark meat they use in some honey chicken chinese dishes and the vegetables tasted like that frozen crap you get out of the grocery store. Like it was just thawed out. for that price ($20) I expected much much more. Even the little box of white rice they gave me tasted bland. Also, they gave me no free appetizers or anything to even snack on like most Asian restaurants would. I was just sitting there for 20 mins with a glass of water waiting for my duck.

Changed job locations so needed to find my new Thai lunch place so Gaati was my first attempt. I ordered Panang Curry with chicken (which is my favorite) and it was ok... a bit too heavy in peanut and their version had peas (not a fan). Their heat index seemed right on and portion size was descent. I think I'll be looking to the next option on the list.

Average Thai food in comfortable dining room.   The room reminds me more of an art gallery than a restaurant, in a good way.  The food reminds me of many other mediocre Thai restaurants I've tried.    The prices here are a little high, but not ridiculous.  I would say come in for the lunch specials during the week to get the most out of Gaati Thai Kitchen.    I came in on President's day (a holiday so no lunch specials) and ordered fresh coconut juice, the curry puffs, and pad see ew, here's the rundown:  Young Coconut -  So refreshing and lovely.  Served with a straw and a spoon, if you've never tried this you really need to.  Be sure to scrape out all that yummy ivory coconut meat after you're done sipping.  The coconut juice pairs really well with spicy food, and it's good for you!  Curry Puffs - Nice fried appetizer.  The flavor of the puff itself wasn't too pronounced, but when eaten with some chili sauce and the cucumber salad/relish it's served with, a very nice way to start the meal out.   Pad See Ew (spicy level 6 out of 10)  - The chinese broccoli wasn't cooked enough, so it had too much crunch for the dish.  The noodles were a bit mushy and again, the flavor was muted.  I can't say it was bad, but it certainly wasn't anything special.     I like the people here and the layout of the restaurant, but that's about it.
This place is amazing!! Some of the best Thai food I've ever had!! Gotta try the thai beef jerky as an appetizer!!! Yummmm
Great Tom Khah soup!! Relatively cheap lunch special. Staff is great, however the decor is missing. It needs some personality!

The short version: Go here!  It's really good. Don't go here when it's busy, you'll experience long waits and cold food. Make sure and order one star spicier than you normally would.  Let me preface this review by saying I've been here 4 or 5 times prior and it's always been a solid 4-star experience.  So when I came in with family from out of town I had high expectations.   It was Saturday night and the team there seemed overwhelmed by the number of tables.  We were seated next to a few people who were waiting for take-out, and nobody approached our table for quite a while because our server got pulled into smoothing things over with a take-out customer who'd experienced an inordinately long wait.    When she finally arrived our server was sweet as pie and made a point of apologizing for the wait and joking with the table.  We ordered an appetizer (Crispy Shrimp) and 4 entrees (Volcano Chicken, Red Curry, Pad Thai, and Laab Gai...my favorite and something I use as a benchmark for thai restaurants).  Then another long wait, 25 minutes while we enjoyed 2 large Singha...and our appetizer came out.  The Crispy Shrimp were delicious, well-seasoned and piping hot but were served ala tempura plate with a bunch of fried veggies that were not mentioned on the menu description.  They were all room temperature, gummy and unappetizing--clearly everything hadn't been fried at one time and as everybody knows cold is the death of fried food.  Our first entree the Volcano Chicken arrived and it was likewise at room temperature.  Not even slightly warm, had clearly been sitting on a counter not even under a heat lamp for at least 10 minutes.  It was a basic sweet and sour and not really to my liking overall, but being cold definitely didn't help.    Luckily our other entrees didn't show up for a while so after some conversation--my partner and I are loath to make waves when eating out unless necessary--we explained our discontent to the server and asked her to make sure the remaining 3 entrees came out hot.  She was extremely apologetic and our Pad thai and Red curry came out quickly.  They were hot and delicious, only complaint was that they definitely didn't measure up to the spice levels we'd requested.  The Laab Gai arrived really late to the point where we thought they'd forgotten we'd ordered it.  Temperature was good, spice level was low and it was lacking in acid...maybe on account of the current lime shortage? Not the best I've had but I'd give it another shot on a return visit.  Sensing our overall discontent our server and another woman I have to think is the manager or owner came by and let us know they were taking the Volcano Chicken off the bill.  This went a long way in improving our experience and will ensure we continue to dine here...were I rating service alone this would've been a 5 star visit.

I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could.   First impression is that this is a nice, quiet, casual, yet elegant Thai oasis in the middle of a strip mall.  The decor of modern Asian minimalism in soft lemongrass and wood tones is very warm and inviting.  We were greeted and seated immediately by one of the friendly and attentive waitstaff.  I felt a disconnect almost immediately after being seated.  The large flatscreen televisions, the R&B music complete with expletives, and the noise coming from the back of the house were confusing and distracting for me.  Maybe this is what the market dictates in this area?  I ordered a glass of house Chardonnay and decided to get over it. It was delicious.   We ordered the Tom Kah and Mongolian Beef, both with medium spice.  Both were very good, and worth ordering again in my opinion.  Again, the waitstaff were all friendly and attentive.  I would probably not go back into the restaurant again, but I would definitely order take out from them.
Awesome food!!! Every order of food was at perfectly desired levels... You can order without a second thought...

I was unprepared to love Gaati as much as I did. It's a tiny little restaurant that is hard to find if you don't know you're looking for it, but it's easily the best thai food in Henderson. The service is quick and helpful, the food is creative and flavorful, and the atmosphere is quiet and warm. My family orders family style, so I've had most things on the menu by now. Try the jungle curry and pad see ew but be careful...when they say the spicy level is 8, they mean it.

Gaati Thai Kitchen has wonderful food, an inviting atmosphere and excellent staff.  The Thai ice tea is served with the sweetener on the side so you can make the tea as sweet (or unsweet) as you like. The kids love the pineapple fried rice served in a pineapple.  I had my Mother's Day dinner at Gaati and was served an unbelievable Sticky Rice and Mango dessert and fried bananas w/ homemade coconut ice cream. YUMMY!

I called to check if the yellow curry was vegan, they let me know that it could be made that way. I placed an order for spicy level 3 (out of 4) They told me it would be ready in ten minutes. I drove over and walked inside, it was a really cute restaurant, good ambiance that would be perfect for a date night. When I walked in no staff was up front, so I stood there for a few minutes before finally someone peeked out of the kitchen and called for one of the servers. The food was delicious. They gave a good amount of food for the price and I will definitely be getting curry here again! The only thing I didn't like was the cubes of tofu. They were cut so big it was awkward to eat! Other than that, great!
This place is the bomb, fresh and delicious it can't get any better than this. I get the spicy shrimp and eggplant and it is to die for!
Excellent doesn't even begin to describe the food. It was exceptional. Fresh, delicious, and the service was fantastic. Highly recommend!!!

I have been wanting to try this place...glad we tried it tonight. Ambiance was great and place looks clean.  We ordered the following items:  1) Dumplings (5 pcs) = It was pretty good. There are enough meat on each dumpling that made this good appetizer considering it's a little pricey for me. The sauce for the dumpling is quite good as well with a hint of ginger and sweetness to it.  2) Thai Tea = Hubby ordered it and he likes it. It was kinda weird that they give you syrup on the side as their thai tea doesn't come sweet to begin with. It was creamy and the tea flavor is not overwhelming.   3) Panang Tofu (Spiceness #1) = This was very good. It was creamy and the flavor was perfect. The tofu came out perfectly fried yet not hard...it was just right. This is definitely comparable to Archi's panang.  4) Panang Beef (Medium Spiceness) = My brother-in-law ordered this and he was quite happy.  He did say that their medium is more spicy that what he normally gets but he loves it nonetheless.   5) Beef Pad See Ew (Spiceness #1) = I was disappointed on this one unfortunately.  I really want to like it but it was bland and dry. It definitely could more sweet soy sauce. I just wouldn't get this in future.   6) Beef Fried Rice (Spiceness #1) = Hubby ordered this and he loves it. He would like to be a little bit more spicy but that did not disappoint him. He loves the flavor of it so he's a happy camper.  Overall, the food is good. They are pricey considering the portions are fairly small.  The service was good but there were only 3 table (including us). One thing we notice though, the table setting was incomplete. We already had our food and we only had napkins and knife on the table.  The server and busboy doesn't seem to communicate well as we haven't even gotten all our food and the busboy is already taking our plates to start clean up which I find odd. I also have to agree with the other review, it is freezing cold in there. The A/C was on full blast which was unnecessary at night I think but it was too cold to be comfortable.  The communication between staff and the cold A/C is where the 1 star deduction came from. We would definitely be back to try the other foods in the menu.

Came here for the first time and LOVED it!  My husband has never liked Thai before. Gaati changed all that! FINALLY I can enjoy Thai on a regular basis with my family!    We had Pad Thai Noodles, Cashew Chicken, Mongolian Beef, and Pineapple Chicken. Everything was great!  Thank you Gaati! We will be back soon!

For Henderson, I guess it was OK.  It had such good reviews, I figured it would be great.  But it was just OK.    The service was good.  And it's a very lovely restaurant.  It's too bad my boss and I were there smelly and disheveled from the field and looked like a couple of turds among the lilies.  But everyone who served us was very polite and quick, and I appreciate that.    The spring roll type appetizer was OK, though a bit overcooked.  Our entrees were also OK but not particularly good.  I asked for my pad thai medium spicy; Boss asked for his eggplant dish extra-super-spicy.  My pad thai was quite spicy (and I'm not a spicy wimp!), and my boss's eggplant dish was bland.  So they seem to have mixed up the heat levels between the two dishes.    My pad thai, besides being strangely spicy, was quite dry and bland and had neither basil nor lime.  And the shrimp, for which I'm sure I paid quite a bit extra, had that muddy flavor that tells me it's probably a good thing it was way-overcooked.  I suppose that's my fault for ordering any kind of seafood in the middle of the freaking desert.  I might eat here again, but I'd be one of those obnoxious people who specifies lots of things.  "I'd like peanuts and basil and lime and cilantro and some actual flavor with my pad thai, please."

We ordered a ton of stuff from here when our 1st choice Thai restaurant was closed unexpectedly for repairs.  Since that was what I had in mind, perhaps I set the bar too high.  We got lots of appetizers, all of which were "good". Nothing remarkable or made us say wow, but not unpalatable either. What stood out were the bbq spare ribs which were fall off the bone outstandingly delicious!!  Not to be missed when ordering from here.  In fact, get two.  The 3 different noodle dishes all basically looked and tasted the same.  I could only tell the difference because of the proteins and one had broccoli in it.  Otherwise, all very similar.  There was nothing necessarily wrong with our meal, but there was no wow factor either.  Just very average.  I wouldn't go out of my way to order from here again.  Not when there is fabulous Thai food in delivery distance from us that always hits the mark.  Sorry, but there is too much competish is this town for mediocre.  Step up your game!   Especially for the listed price point.  What we got should not have cost as much as it did.

They have a beautiful dining room. They have the prices to prove it. I just wish the food was better.   Ordered the chicken tom yum soup. I ordered the small for 8 dollars. I thought I would get more than just 1 3/4 cup of soup. It was REALLY sour. I ordered it medium spicy and it didn't taste spicy at all. The broth was flavorless and the chicken was tough.  Overall, If this place wants to charge Lotus of Siam prices for Lotus of Siam portion sizes, they better have amazing food... unfortunetely its subpar. You'll get better portion sizes for a cheaper price with better quality food at the Pin Kaow down the road on Eastern about 3 minutes away.

To say I am a regular is an understatement. It's almost embarrassing how often I eat here. My regular lunch buddy has strict dietary limitations; Gaati modifies everything so he can eat a real meal.   Prices on the entrees are a tad higher than some other Thai restaurants in town, but I taste the difference in the food. Definitely worth the difference.  The lunch special is awesome for a mere $9 - soup, salad, a curry puff and a main dish with rice. Brown rice is available for an extra buck.   Closed Mondays, so plan accordingly.

I like the atmosphere here.  It's casual and very comfortable.  I usually come here for lunch.  The lunch special is a great deal.  Soup, salad an entree for less than $10.00.  Great service and very, very fast!  I love the green curry here and you can get it as mile or as spicy as you like.  One of my favorite places.

The best thai restaurant I've been to! On my first visit I had red chicken curry and bbq fried rice and they were the bomb! I had to come back to try other dishes as well. The spare ribs were also very tasty. The pad thai was a bit different than what im used to but it was still great nonetheless.

Was so wanting to love this place. Maybe my expectations were too high since other yelp reviews were good. I was rushed off phone when I finished the order & asked for a price "I'll call you back", click, didn't even get to ask for brown rice with my curry. My pumpkin curry was super bland & definitely not medium in heat level, plus they didn't give me the extra chili peppers I requested. I may be a white, born & raised in New England person, but I want to break a sweat when I order spicy Thai. They say their spicy scale is 1-4, so I asked for 3, but no heat maybe a 2 on my beloved Thai Noodle House's 1-10 scale. Luckily I had a jar of sliced green Thai chilies at home, but had to add about 2 tablespoons which added heat but some flavor would have been nice too.  Tried his pad see ew after he declared it "horrible". I'd never met a pad see ew I didn't like, until now. Noodles sticky, probably from the starch, not the sauce which was also bland. Plus the veggies in it were not the same as other Thai restaurants - only broccoli & collard-like greens.   I was hoping the food would have made up for the service both when I ordered & when he picked up. But sadly, this is not even on par with the other nearby Thai restaurants on Eastern & near Galleria which only deserved 1-2 visits each. Guess Henderson is not the place for good Thai - need to drive farther into Vegas.

Ate here a couple of months ago, but the restaurant looked nice and well kept.  Service was ok and the food was pretty good, but I wasn't wowed at all.  I'd go back if I needed a quick fix for some Thai but that's all

This by far my FAVORITE Thai restaurant!! Whatever they put in that papaya salad is perfect flavoring.  I must eat here once a week and I am never dissatisfied.   I keep going back for more.  Tom kha Gai, chicken pad Thai and papaya salad are my favorites!!  Love how it's near my home and Service is good!! I will see you soon Gaati!

I should have paid more attention to the bad reviews, they are correct.  Ordered chicken pad won sen, shrimp pad thai and beef salad to go.  The salad was okay, beef super well done and lacked lettuce.  The dinners had very minimal vegetables which were all overcooked, the chicken and shrimp were overcooked, overall it was a bunch of noodles with not enough sauce or vegetables.    The server seemed nice though and appeared to be a chill environment to dine.  It is a shame the food is not better, it has a good location as well.

I have been here before and thought it was nice. The dinning room is clean and nicely decorated. The last time I came I think the owner was there.This time the waiter was a guy with a very dry personality, not very pleasant at all.At first I took it personal but I watched him interact with other customers and he was the same with them.He is in the wrong business.  I ordered the chicken padti, basil chicken and a side of egg rolls.I asked how many comes in a order, he said 6 so I said ok but he came back later and said 5.I thought that was a lot per order but when I got them I saw why, they were mini rolls like one bite each.Had I known I would not have ordered them.  He asked how spicy I wanted it.I said a 7, he said they only had 1 thru 4, I said 3. My order was to go.The food was very bland and no spice at all.I was very dissapointed. Later my stomach became upset and I spent my evening on the toilet. I know it was this food as it was the only thing I ate that day.  Very upset and dissapointed. I paid alot for the food as well.They are pretty pricey. Won't go back!!
The worst Asian food I've ever had! Everything was over cooked and I called to talked to the manager who didn't seem to care. Eat somewhere else! Too many great options!

Found this quaint little place near Trader Joes and Kmart off Eastern Ave. in Henderson. When we walked in we were impressed with the décor. It looked so nice that I thought it was going to be expensive. To our surprised the menu prices were pretty reasonable. The food was tasty and delicious. Our party ordered sweet and sour chicken lunch special and it came with salad, soup and a hefty stuff wonton. The portions were a good size. Someone else order crab friend rice and wow was it good. I ordered pad thai and it was decent. WARNING: Their spice range is on point. When they say hot...It's going to be hot. My lips and tongue were on fire! When your brow sweats you know it's hot. So order a level down and it will be perfect. Anyways we will be definitely visiting this place again.

Best Thai Food I've had in years  What I was the most impressed about Gaati is that their sauces and ingredients are fresh, and the balance in flavor is unadulterated, authentic.    Many Thai restaurants I've been to try to put too much sugar in the food and it doesn't taste right, but Gaati has the right amount of heat, great flavors and just a really pleasant presentation of food!   I absolutely love this place!  What we ordered:  1. Treasure bags--very crispy, very flavorful chicken and corn filling, amazing appetizer  2. Satay pork--perfectly cooked.  delicious marinade  3.  chicken curry puffs--really good  4. Pad Thai--best Pad Thai in America!   Very spicy, very fresh, it's just so different from the other pad thai's I've had!  5. Pad kra pow chicken--chicken with chili and basil, it's so delicious with rice.  6.  Chicken Tom Kah--really dense broth with very good flavors.    Great openner to any dish.  7. Fresh green curry--OMG so fresh it's amazing!  8. Crispy pork belly with Chinese broccoli--excellent flavors, crispy, and the gai lan is still a bit crunchy which is nice  9. the minced chicken dish served in lettuce cups--very refreshing!  All in all, I love this place.   I would drive from LA to Henderson just for this restaurant!

We ordered pineapple fried rice at a hefty price of 16 bucks and it was shown to come in a pineapple and have shrimp inside. Well when we got our food delivered it had 2 shrimps inside a normal metal delivery container. Needless to say we paid 16 bucks for some rice. Not happy at all.  Our total order was over 40 bucks and was not worth the hefty price. We called to ask how many shrimp should be inside and the girl on the phone had an answer of "I don't know".

Place is horrible Cold rice, ordered everything medium-hot it was sweet Paid additional $3 for shrimp there were 4 shrimp total in the pad Thai... The catfish came as little chunks  The salad was wilted Paid $70 and am completely upset If it weren't for my girlfriend picking this up out of the goodness of her heart I'd take it back but I just had surgery  WHO POSSIBLY RATED THIS PLACE 4 STARS wish I cooked it myself their chefs are an embarrassment to Thai food

Ordered dinner on Sunday, July 26,2015 and picked up within 20 minutes - nice!  We ordered the yellow chicken curry (hot), pork pad see ew (hot), crispy rice salad (hot), spicy basil (hot), crab fried rice (hot), and bbq spare ribs.  Food can be ordered on a scale from "not hot" to "Thai hot", with "hot" being the 2nd to highest.  They did a nice job on the heat!  We forgot to order the curry with no heat, and my son's poor girlfriend was drinking milk (which she doesn't enjoy) to try to cool her burning mouth.  The rest of us loved it!  I really liked the crispy rice salad - it was nice having a cool dish, and the lettuce and rice were crisp.  The pad see ew was very good as well, with the flavors well married but not overly sweet and the broccoli was perfectly cooked.  The crab fried rice was a nice surprise and something new to try - it was very tasty with nice sizes of crab meat.  The spicy basil had a nice basil flavor but was a bit too sweet.  I was too full by then and never got around to trying the curry or ribs.  When I picked up the order, the restaurant was quiet.  It's very pretty, with cloth tabletops and a relaxing vibe.  I like the view of the outdoor landscaping from the side glass door.  Our To Go order came served in rectangle plastic containers (yea! no styrofoam) with clear lids, and for the most part the servings were quite generous.  The odd one was the spicy basil, which was quite a small portion and the curry was a smaller portion than expected (served in a plastic cylinder-shaped container).  Thank you, Gatti Thai, for a lovely meal!

This place has a great ambiance, totally appropriate for intimate gathering. Service was relatively prompt. We had the chicken pad Thai, beef green curry, and a scoop of the coconut ice cream. When we received the dishes I noticed immediately that the portion sizes were a little on the small side; I could probably count the bamboo shoots in the curry on 2 hands, and the rice came in the same size dish I used to serve butter in when I worked at a restaurant back in the day. It was easy to overlook a bit because the flavors on the noodles were definitely there, the green curry was good (not great), and the ice cream had good flavor even if the consistency had a lot to be desired. We ordered the entrees at a level-2 (of 4) in spice and I typically add more chili powder once it's on my plate but I was surprised when it had a nice little kick to it. If you're sensitive to spice, get the chili on the side. Overall, if it wasn't for the nice ambiance and the service this would for sure be a 3-Star review.    PROS: Pad Thai (chicken) had good flavor.  Menu featured duck.  Ambiance is nice.  Service was prompt.   CONS: Beef in our green curry was kind of tough.  No pork on the menu, whaaaa?! Coconut ice cream was especially icy. Where's the rest of my food? (Portion size, even on the side of rice were less than generous)

Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but there are better Thai places in the area. I think the portion sizes were a bit small for the price, and there was nothing particularly exciting about the restaurant. The restaurant was small, so probably not a good place for a large group.
What I love about this place is that the service is constantly fabulous the food is wonderful and the company divine. Love everything about it is specially the too young lady sitting next to us.

The restaurant has great ambiance and comfortable chairs.  The food and service are great.  My favorite items were the crab rangoon and the chicken satay.  The satay peanut sauce was so good I wanted to drink it.  Save room for the homemade coconut ice cream.
Good curry puffs. Crispy rice salad too salty. Pad Thai a bit greasy. Not planning on returning.

The atmosphere here is so relaxing and we love coming here Friday night after a long week. The food is also addictive. I had the rama chicken (grilled chicken and spinach with peanut sauce) during our first visit and it was very tasty, though I might see if it's possible to add a little spice another time. My husband loved his massaman curry! During our second visit, the food was about a level spicier than we were expecting, but still delectable! I ordered beef pad see ew which is one of my favorite Thai dishes, and it did not disappoint. My husband ordered the jungle curry which is a bit more soup like and he really enjoyed it too! On another note, sometimes the service can be a bit slow, but the food is well worth the visit! We love this place and will definitely be back!

I love Thai food and I have to say this is one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever had.  Without even the slightest reservation I will say they have the best crab rangoon I've ever had.  Their green curry and pad Thai are also amazing.  What a sweet surprise to have such a delicious dinner.  :)

I like the interior of the place; its got a nice warm modern feel to it. Selection of food choices are a bit different from other thai places; there seems to be chinese style dishes mixed with thai dishes and this meant there were fewer choices for thai ones.  I had the pork belly with chinese broccoli (with jasmin rice) and it was quite tasty.  Not overcooked or too over-spiced. Overall the experience was good; service was good and it wasnt crowded at all for a saturday night.   Prices are slightly higher than other thai places in the area and the food was not exactly better so I'll just stick with my current fav siri thai.

Their Tom Kha was one of the best richest flavors in town! Unfortunately, their Thai basil beef is not made traditionally with minced meat but does have a wonderful flavor as well. The pananag was a BIG let down as it was more of a soup than a "paste" like panang should be. Will just have to skip that when eating here, but everything was pretty Delish!

I've been enjoying this place for over year now and they are very consistent in service and food quality as well as great taste. I enjoy eating in the restaurant and every much enjoyed their delivery service. I highly recommend this to everyone.

Small, casual place located inside a plaza off eastern. I was just looking for a casual spot for lunch and I did find that.   They have happy hour menu items and I ordered the edamame. Not a bad portion size however, the edamame were pretty sad looking. I was expecting full, plump edamame but was disappointed in the quality of it. It was like they microwaved a bag from the freezer section and put it on the plate. I had to ask for a plate for the shells. It wasn't busy at all but the waiters were not moving with any sense of urgency when being asked for things by the 3 patrons eating lunch.  I ordered the spicy eggplant which is something I always order from thai places. This one was extremely greasy and when I asked for mild heat, I didn't know that meant ZERO heat because I didn't even taste a hint. I ordered it with vegetables instead of rice and there were barely any added to the entree. I'll probably look for another thai place in the area rather than coming back here.

What a gem! Ambiance, service and presentation were all great. The food was delicious. I had the green curry which they were able to modify as I am vegan. It looks like most items on their menu can be modified if you are vegetarian or vegan. I will definitely be going back.
This has been my go to place for Thai. It is decorated very classy without trying to hard. It is always clean, and the service is great. The food is very tasty and fresh. I have become a regular here

Just finished my lunch special of pad Thai. This is my first visit and most likely my last. I love Thai food and have been to many establishments around the valley. I had high hopes since this place had decent reviews.  Prices were a little more than I usually pay, but I figure if it's good than it doesn't matter.  I ordered a number 7 spice, it was so bland I had to add my own salt and chili sauce at home.  I ordered extra bean sprouts and was charged $2 which is overly priced and have never been charged extra at any time restaurant I been to. I didn't think much of it until I got home and there wasn't extra at all!   The curry puff was still frozen inside so it's obviously was not made fresh. The soup was okay, but also on the bland side.  I'm disappointed in this visit. So sad because the decor and service was great hence the 2 stars.

Ordered crab fried rice and tom yum shrimp. I am always put off when tom yum does not come with straw mushrooms, so this was my first disappointment. My daughter wanted to try the crab fried rice, and the crab was overcooked. Portion sizes were smaller than other restaurants in area, and it was a bit more pricey. I will not return.

This eatery has its ups and down. We recently ordered take out curries and wings. It was as good as when they first opened. So glad we gave it another shot. Very prompt service as well. Takes only 15 minutes! Guess the curry paste is all ready and all they have to do is put in the protein.

I have a territory in Henderson and once a week  I will taste a Thai lunch special red curry. This is the second time I have eaten at Gaati and the food is of a higher standard than everyone else. The curry is creamer  than any other and the spring rolls taste homemade.

Surprisingly, we were not expecting to find a nicely decorated restaurant with such vibrant aesthetics.  Being tucked away in the corner of Eastern Blvd and Horizon Ridge Pkwy, this is a dope spot for casual dining with a group or even with just a table for two.  --Thai beef jerky: great flavors from the spices they used to marinate the meat.  Dish comes with dipping sauce which wasn't too salty unlike what other joints usually serve.  Order a side of sticky rice and you're good to go.   --Spicy grilled beef salad: could have used extra toasted rice but the skirt steak was tender and chili-lime vinaigrette was good.   --Pad Thai: typical Thai style thin noodles sauteed with eggs, bean sprouts, chives and crushed peanuts.  Got it in 'hot' and thought it would've been 9/10 if it were from a different place.  **Spiciness from this establishment runs hotter than others... have your dish in 'medium' instead and just add more crushed peppers to suit your taste buds.   --Pineapple fried rice (shrimp, chicken, fresh pineapples, roasted cashews) that was actually served in whole pineapple shell.  I like the mixture of savory and sweet, however, seasoning was lacking as the dish was quite bland.  Overall, Gaati Thai Kitchen is definitely one of the better Thai restaurants around Southeast Las Vegas.  Delicious food, nice ambiance and great service.  They also have a daily happy hour with drink specials and reduced price on certain appetizers.

Have been here about a dozen times in the past two years and the food is always fantastic: very flavorful and never greasy/oily. The service is always polite and fast, and I love the calm ambiance. The new grilled Brussels Sprouts appetizer is delicious, as are all the curries. I do wish they offered fresh spring rolls (the type wrapped in rice paper filled with basil, fresh vegetables, and tofu) with peanut sauce.

I have been to this restaurant twice and everything that I have had has been wonderful. I absolutely love the Papaya Salad, the peanuts give it a great crunch and add texture to the dish. The coconut chicken soup is creamy and rich. The entrees are delish too. I have been to Thailand and this is the best since I have been back. The coconut icecream is homemade and very good (not too sweet). The lunch options are great with a great value. Check it out.

This place delivers! *heart eyes emoji*  I work in a medical building that's about a 5 min drive from this place. Sometimes when days are super busy, I like to order for delivery just so I don't have to leave my fellow staff without help. They are always on time if not faster than expected!  Food is always fresh, flavorful, and the staff are very courteous and kind. My favorite is the Pad Kee Maow or Pad See Ew. Mmmmm!

My boyfriend and I came here to eat lunch this afternoon. First of all, we came with our 8 month old daughter in her infant carrier and they put us at a table right next to the kitchen. And I mean the closest possible table to the kitchen. I ordered the Thai pad chicken lunch special, he ordered Fat see u beef. My salad came first with my Miso soup and  they were both ok. My Pad Thai came out and we waited almost 10 minutes for his entree. All this time I was waiting for his food, so we could eat together. When I finally took a bite, the Pad Thai was EXTREMELY hot when I asked for Medium. I noticed it was practically covered in Chili flakes. I politely asked if they could tone down the spicy and they took the plate back, all the while I heard the cooks and waiter talking junk about us in the kitchen. My boyfriend's food comes out and his isn't even hot. Almost another 15 minutes goes by until I get my new Pad Thai which was alot less spicy but also looked watery and soupy. Finally, after another 10 minutes my curry puffs that were supposed to come with my soup and salad come out and they are burnt to a crisp. I asked the waiter for new ones since I wouldn't be eating those. My boyfriend wanted to just walk out but I insisted we stay because I was hungry. Long story short, the waiter asked me AT LEAST 6 times if everything was ok. Felt kind of weird. When we were done,  I had to wait almost 15 more minutes for the check. Almost an hour after we get home from lunch, I'm vomiting constantly and although I might not have food poisoning, I am headed to the hospital. I truly believe these people did something shady to my food. I will never be back and I warn everyone that goes there about asking to fix or modify a dish might leave you in my situation. This place is my new least favorite restaurant. And just before you go judging my tone about this incident, my boyfriend and I both work as a server and a manager at 2 different restaurants here in Vegas, one off the strip and the other on the strip and neither of us had ever given or experienced as bad service as we dealt with today.

Food is good. Service was without attention to detail. I'll go back, but I expect better service.  MISSES:  1) Five in our party, four menus given.   2) Someone in our party was brought the wrong entree.   3) Water was asked for, one glass for one person not brought out.  4) Bill and credit card receipt was brought out without a pen.   Again, I'll go back, but service will have to be better than this or ill go back to my favorites Lotus of Siam or Archie's.

Like a few others before me mentioned I should have taken a look at the reviews before visiting.  I ordered Thai beef jerky $10.00) as an appetizer and to their recognition it was tender, tasty and seemed like it was a high quality meat, however this would be the only good experience with their food that day.    We dined around 2:30 so they still had their lunch specials running, my girlfriend and I both ordered the Mongolian beef ($9.99) which came with a soup and house salad.  I also ordered Thai house fried rice $11.00 + $4.00 if you want to add a meat).  They have a spice level of 1-4,  I ordered at 3 and she at a 2.    The salad would be as you expected however the dressing was extremely sweet, almost to a point that when eating the Thai jerky it changed its flavor profile and not in a good way.  The soup was a cream based soup and very bland.  When the main meal arrived I was shocked at how absolutely small the portions were.  I wasn't expected a main meal portion do to it being a lunch special however the portion of rice I would equate to an ice cream scoop and the beef contained less that a cup and was lodes high with rice noodles.  The food was bland at the very least and what flavor it did have was so sweet I took one bite and had the waiter return it.  I figured I would be content with the fried rice when it arrived but it had less flavor then the beef and consistency was more like uncle bens rice.  The waiter was professional and did take these items off the bill, but it was clear with one bite from each dish it was not enjoyed and he didn't ask for feedback but I certainly gave it.  The only thing I didn't add is the decor was nice but seemed very Americanized and the prices at this place are not on par with the quality.  Their prices seem more fine dining when it should be more like a fast food China a go go.  I have no plans on returning however if you do choose to go here I suggest ordering at a spicy level 4 and going before 3 and take advantage of the lunch special.

The Happy hour specials we ate made a wonderful combination for my husband and I - the Mango salad and the Curry puffs complimented each other with the dressing and sauce they came with!  BBQ chicken is marinated just right and their coconut ice cream has these wonderful tidbits of tropical flavor from the jackfruit (Lanka) they add to their homemade recipe. We will be back for more Happy Hours!

By far my most favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. Wonderful flavors, very consistent, nice atmosphere. There is room for some improvement with their service, as well as the amount of rice they serve with their curry. Take-out, however, seems to have portions that are more generous. My favorites: Massaman Curry- rich flavor, not to sweet. Pad See Ew- perfectly balanced sauce. Tom Kha Gai- wonderfully balanced as well. Pad Thai- not too tangy, not too sweet. Highly recommended!

I had food delivered and it was great.  I ordered the crispy duck and bbq fried rice. My duck was nice and crispy without being greasy and my fried rice was wonderful.  My food was delivered quickly and tasted delicious!

I love Thai; this is a great Thai restaurant. It was bought in the last year or so, so there is new management, though I never ate there before. The food is very fresh, the Thai spices are right on, and the menu has more than just the traditional dishes. Highly recommended.
I just ordered the Panang  curry for pickup. It is excellent. Not overly sweet and has the consistency of gravy with slivers of peppers in it. DELICIOUS YUMMY !!!!!!!
Delicious place! My go-to for Thai since my reg place has disappointed me time after time. Gaati is consistently tasty and their quality is on point.
Great dining experience! The food and service were wonderful and I did not have one single bad experience. I can't wait to go back.
Very disappointed!! Must be under new ownership. Ordered take out and it was awful, if I were eating there it would all have been sent back. Definitely won't be going back!!!

The crab rangoon is the best I have had because I don't like onion and this one is without. I ordered online and an hour and a half later I called to check where the order was. A very nice lady told me that it had just went out for delivery and if I hadn't gotten it within 10 minutes to please call back. 30 minutes later... nothing. I called and a man tells me that hey never received my order but I was very close and they could have it to me in 10 minutes if I still wanted it. I'm not sure how he knew I was close because I hadn't told him my address, only my name to find the order (which they never got). It seems they had gotten the order and misplaced it, which is fine if they would have just admitted their mistake. He offered a free Thai iced tea for the trouble. I clarified my order twice with him to not have onions... it showed up with massive chunks of onion, over 2 1/2 hours late, and full price. I am incredibly disappointed & don't believe I will be dining here again.

I have been waiting for good Thai food  in the neighborhood for a long time. Last week I happen to see Gaati Thai Kitchen while on my way to work. I decided to go for Lunch the same day, which I'm glad I  did.  I have been here 3 times for Lunch and once for dinner, my girlfriend and I both agree that Gaati Thai Kitchen remains by far the best Thai food I've had on both coasts.  My favorite dish there, the Pad Thai, is better than the Pad Thai I've had in Thailand. The noodles are firm, never soggy, and the flavor is always well balanced. The Chicken (a must) is extremely fresh, large quantity, and generous. Their curries are all fantastic -- over the course of four visits, my favorite curry has grown to be the Massaman curry. Chicken Tom Kah,Crab Fried Rice are awesome too.  Friendly staff makes the atmosphere even better. Their desserts are great (especially Gaati Thai Sundae and Fried Banana with Thai Coconut Ice Cream)  I recommend going there for lunch, as although the portions are good, the prices are a LOT cheaper (approx $9 will get you a nice lunch special) Parking is convenient so  you can cross that of the list.
Excellent food and service. House made coconut ice cream is to die for. Highly recommend spicy beef salad!

Amazing! I'm rather picky about my Thai food. But a visiting friend checked out Yelp and we decided to give this place a try.   We're vegan and I ordered the mild green curry with mixed vegetables and jasmine rice. DELICIOUS! We also ordered a plate of veggie spring rolls. Seriously, so good. I would go back JUST for more spring rolls!   The waitstaff was extremely attentive, my water glass wasn't even 1/4 way down from the top and they rushed right over to refill it. When I asked the rest to be put in to-go containers, they made sure to provide us with extra rice to take home with us also.   VERY good, I'll definitely be back. I live in Summerlin, but for amazing food and service like this, I have no problem driving to Henderson for it!  It's a great little place tucked in the corner, very classy decor. (VERY clean bathrooms too! big plus!)

We ordered delivery and when the food came it tasted all like plastic or dirty dishwater. I honestly don't know if we just caught them on a bad day or if this is the quality of food they put out all the time. $50 bucks in the trash. What a shame.
Ordered the lunch special Yellow curry with chicken. Came with rice, salad, soup and pastry. Overall food and service was good.

Went there on a Sunday night for dinner with family. We waited for more than 30 minutes after ordering, we finally had to ask the server to check on our dishes when there was no sign of our food coming when we saw tables that came after us getting their food. And when the food finally came, we found out that they forgot to put the order in on a dish. They were, however, able to bring out the dish within a few minutes. This made us wonder why the other dishes took so long.   The food is okay, not traditional Thai in our opinion. Portions are okay as well, typical Thai food portions. The service was subpar to say the least, not very organized and not very experienced staff. If you are looking for traditional Thai food, this is probably not the place. Pretty disappointed with the experience, will not likely to return.
I like it. One of my two favorite Thai food places in Las Vegas.  Everything was as expected for Thai food and great service.

I love this place. We order food their pretty consistently. I prefer the take- out experience over the dine in experience. Yummy Thai food! I want more of that coconut water. Pad se ew and Pad thai are mine and my husbands favorite dishes! I also like their tofu.They also have quick delivery and great customer service

This is my local neighborhood Thai choice, when I need a last minute meal to take home I call ahead to pick-up... usually the spicy basil or eggplant dish. Very accommodating for vegan friends- i am always so surprised how good they are at clarifying about the ingredients! Nice to experience that type of service. I have also enjoyed their lunch specials too...nice portion size for me.   Last time I was disappointed with the amount of Chinese broccoli in my pad see ew but glad it still packed the normal punch of tasty, yummy flavors.

We forgot to post on yelp, but a few days ago we ordered food for delivery. This is the worst place to get your food delivery. They were supposed to be here an hour ago and its been and hour and a half they said the driver was lost. The food had arrived and it was cold, and very soggy. Who would eat there meal when the curry lid was not on correct and split all over the bag they and forgot one of our items. It was a hot mess. The meat was over cooked to hard to chew, and this place is totally not worth the money. I found better Thai places before that I rather go to... We ordered the pineapple fried rice, and not worth the money. The meals just was not pleasant and this was a totally waste of money.

I LOVE the Chicken Pad Thai at Gaati Thai Kitchen. Hands down the best I've had since I left Asia in December. The Curry Puffs were also quite great. I thought the delivery price was a tad high, at $3 (we're less than .5 miles away). Lesson learned though- just go pick it up! And I definitely will in the future, quite often.

What happened to you Gaati!?! Every time we ordered from you it is usually  a hit. A few times it was not consistent. This time is the last straw... We ordered delivery of $50 of the chicken pad Thai, broccoli with fried pork, tofu paw see wheewwwwww and mango sticky rice. With a side order of the vinegar green chili.   Once we got our order to the door, both noodle dishes lacked favor. We barely even see the meat/tofu. And they said the side order of chili was rotten so they didn't put that in. It's one of the best part to put in the noodles if you want a tangy hot kick to the dish. And to top it off... the mango dessert looks like they give us half of a rotten mango WITHOUT the coconut sauce. WTF. This order was not worth over $50 for shitty food.   You guys lost a customer.

Easily my favorite neighborhood Thai restaurant. The staff are friendly, the restaurant is clean and inviting, and the food is especially memorable. I'm a big noodle fan, so pad see ew is always a must. And their pineapple fried rice is amazing! It comes in a pineapple with hefty portions of perfectly seasoned chicken and shrimp. Yum!

Me and a few coworkers went here for lunch today. Lunch for us is 11-12. We arrived at 11:10 and were the first ones in. Atmosphere was really nice and seemed clean. Good start! Glance at the lunch menu (somewhat limited) and quickly decide our orders. Placed our order, and began to wait. And wait. And wait. About 20 minutes later, we saw the cook walk through the front door! Next thing we hear are pots and pans shuffling around and finally some food being cooked. About 10 minutes later, we finally get our soup and salad. Then about 5-10 minutes after that, food arrives.  The food was pretty decent, but portion size was small for the spicy basal and sweet and sour chicken. Pad Thai was a good portion, however we only received 2 shrimp with the combination plate. Just 2? Hmm.. We ended up being late to work because it took so long. Why open the restaurant if the cook isn't there? Just an overall bad experience that unfortunately helped us decide never to return.

This is my first Thai restaurant since I've relocated from LA. We started with Chicken Satay as our appertzer. I found it to be very tender. My daughter did not care for the peanut sauce. For my main entrée I ordered traditional Pad Thai with shrimp. I found the rice noodles very petite and tight. The shrimp was surprisingly larger than I expected. My daughter ordered Crab fried rice. She found it to be fishy with a heavy egg taste. She was not expecting a heavy egg taste. It distracted from the blended flavors. My husband ordered the Pineapple Chicken.  He loved the taste, but he felt it could have had  more bellpeppers and onions. We also tried the Thai tea. I thought it was great. My daughter thought too much cream. Dad order a Coke he was happy. Would we come back.....probably not. Would I recommend...no. The service was great and the first impress was nice.

Yummy!! Had the lunch special with my mom. Sates & pad Thai. The creme corn soup is AMAZING! Very nice atmosphere and staff. Only reason not a 5 star is we requested no onions in my moms dish and it had onions. Definitely recommend and will return.

First time trying Gaati, was highly recommended by both my friend and by another friend of my wifes. We ordered pad thai, yellow curry, and stuffed chicken wing. Yellow curry was ok but super light in the chicken and loaded with undercooked potatoes and carrots. Pad thai was pretty bad, lacked flavors, lacked peanuts, no limes, and no sauces, but worst of all seemed very old like leftovers, was one gelatonous cubular mass in the container solid as a whole yet composed of very mushy noodles. I had to cut it like lasagna to plate for my family. Stuffed chicken wings were ok, Ive had better at siri thai for much less, and siri thai isnt exactly the standard of excellence for thai in henderson either, readers may remember siri was famously caught last year by the health dept recycling rice off of bussed dirty dishes from the dining room.
