Nice decent place. Music played Hard Rock which does not match the clientele. Two TVs were ON but no sound. Food is excellent, the Catfish was deboned and Spicy basil chicken although too sweet was good; but the white rice could be warmer not seemingly cold. The server was kind to suggest next time to ask for AMERICAN or THAI authentic styles.   The charged additional Extra rice contrary to what the other server mentioned. The other Thai Restaurant on Eastern Ave do not. Guess we'll be going there more!
This restaurant is super clean and very good food. The presentation is everything and the prices on food are amazing. Great great Thai food.

Been coming here four about three years now and just realized I never wrote a Yelp review for this place. The customer service is always attentive and it's never to crowded which is nice. The appetizers are really nice. I like the curry puffs. And for dinner I recommend the red curry.  Really good place and the Thai tea is good to. Would definitely recommend for anyone who likes Thai food or anyone looking to try some good  Thai food.

Really good place for take out Thai food. Our go to place is Thai house but gaati Thai is a contender. I tried their veggie medley with tofu and their fish cake salad  (forgot the actual name). Both were really good. These were two new dishes for me but you can't go wrong with stir fry veggies and tofu w/ brown rice. The veggies were perfectly cooked (cabbage, mushrooms, carrots, tomatoes, and broccoli) and the tofu (firm) was nicely marinated and slightly fried. I got the dish a medium spice level but it wasn't hot at all so I had to add garlic chili sauce to it when I got home. The fish cake salad was new for me so I didn't know what to expect from a fish cake. The texture is kinda different but it was ok for me. The salad came in a crispy taco shell like bowl full of lettuce, bell peppers and cucumbers with a side of vinegarette dressing that was yummy but it was super thick like a chutney so it was more of a dipping sauce than dressing. The staff is super nice and the decor is pleasant and good for a date night out. I'll definitely try it again.
Food always excellent. Nice inside. Have never heard "rap" music. Don't listen to bad reviews, go see for yourself. We love this place and order at least twice a month.

We were huge Archi 's Thai fans but whoa this place is pretty fantastic and at lunch you hardly have anyone there.   Favs: Basil Thai with pork (wish it were ground instead of sliced), jungle curry chicken, Pad Thai chicken, the salmon is awesome, sea bass is equally awesome and I could eat a ton of the crab fried rice!

Gaati has a solid 4 star review on Yelp, it should be 4.5-5. Seems many of the complaints come from reviews on dishes that are Americanized or Chinese in nature... Here's my tip... Don't order those!!!   My mom and I came here on an early Friday night, I enjoyed the interior, it was not as "gallery-esque" as many of the other reviews stated. In my opinion, it is simple, clean, & modern. Nothing wrong with that!! It was although smaller than I had expected, but this makes for quiet, quick, attendant service.   For the food:  - appetizer: Papaya salad. Very yummy and perfect for summertime. It's cool and crisp with chilled shrimp on top, and thin cabbage leaves to make a wrap if you desire. Everywhere else that I've had this dish (including my grandma's) is way too spicy, even when ordered mild, this dish on the other hand could have actually used more spice... So for next time I know! If you've never had papaya salad, and are unfamiliar with fish sauce, this will be entirely new for you!   -entree: Green curry with chicken. I was SO pleased with this dish. I know how I want my green curry, and this was perfect! It was creamy with the perfect amount of heat. Perfect balance of bamboo shoots and Thai basil, yum! Plus, what I find lacking in many curry dishes is the quality of the chicken... This chicken was memorable, tender and cut into strips, whereas other restaurants seem to make the chicken a weak accessory to the dish. They have green peas in this, which is new to me... but they were rare, so I didn't mind, haha. Also, they don't skip out on the rice here, hallelujah!!!!   My mom got yellow curry and enjoyed it very much and kept saying, "mmm, just like mom's!" Neither of us finished and were able to take home a generous amount of leftovers while also leaving quite satisfied!   Another thing I should remark on is the price, I don't feel it is over priced, it is pretty standard especially for the quality and location. The two of us dined for $44 with two specialty drinks, an appetizer, & two entrees... Not bad, not bad at all!   So try out a little, hidden, Henderson gem for some satisfying Thai food. I may be their new regular!

Okay here we go on this review. The Green Curry made in Medium was awesome and GREAT tasting. The only thing is the menu reads Fresh bird eye chili paste, bamboo shoots, basil, coconut milk and a choice of your meat chicken beef or pork.  When I got home as I ordered this to go. The container had Zucchini with red and green bell peppers which was not stated. Good thing I am not allergic to those vegetables as they should disclosed this on there discription in there menu.  Green Curry was yummy. I don't know if you eat in they give you a better portion size because the container was just enough for one person and I don't eat much. I will go back and eat in the next time and try the green curry again to see if the consistantcy of quality is just as good when I just had it.  I will try to give other menu items a try to and will see if other  friends would like to try this place with me as a sit down meal.  From going in the Restruant the ambiance was very inviting and clean and nice and bright color decor.  Restruant looks well kept and clean and nice table room not cluttered and close to the next person.  Friendly staff was very welcoming!

Ordered food to pick up and what a cute little restaurant, definitely not busy during the time I came but it was a super clean facility. Not many places have it, it's not even a hole in the wall, there was more tables and I love how the kitchen doesn't even look like a kitchen! The gentleman that helped me was nice as well as the other ones that were serving food. I think I will come back and dine in! But the food is superb! Wonton soup isn't too salty and definitely not bland, just right! And the fried rice is amazing with tofu with a medium kick to it! I gotta say this might be my new favorite Thai place!

"My husband has a pretty high tolerance for spice but went with their "medium" spicy. To test out our first order. It was way hotter than it should have been. He normally gets the "Thai Spicy" from Pinkaow, which is just above their 10 level but said Gaatis medium was just as hot if not hotter. For a medium spice level, it was way too hot."  Pinkaow actually underspices in my opinion. They are scared you will send it back because it will be too spicy. In fact no matter how many times I have asked them for thai spicy they always give me medium.   And yes you are correct, Thai Spicy at Gaati is very spicy, but very good.

I came to this spot with a friend for the 1st time about 2 months ago. We were the only 2 people in the restaurant. Made me a little nervous. Started out with a small chicken tom yum soup and an Asahi beer. Happy hour special so the beer was only $2.50! Then my entree. Yellow chicken curry (med). I was pleasantly surprised! The service was really good! Attentive and accommodating! The food was exceptionally awesome! Since that 1st visit I am now a loyal customer! The best part is that it's right down the street from my house! I'm all about this spot!!

The dining room is lovely.  The service at first was way too slow.  Once they picked up, it was much better.  The drinks were always warm or hot.  Hot beer and hot San Pellegrino is yuck.  Food was OK.  I asked for the hottest and the spice was good.

I'm glad I came to try this place with my friend tonight, the waitress is very friendly and sweet, the mango salad and pineapple fried rice and the mango sticky rice are the best!! I will be back again for sure!!!

This restaurant has excellent food when I went and picked it up myself... however, when I used Grubhub to order for six people including children for dinner tonight, they repeatedly lied to me: first, the driver is here and about to walk out the door (15min after they were supposed to be here) ten minutes later (the restaurant is less than a mile away) they're walking out the door now, I told them they needed to be here in five minutes; twenty minutes later, no show. Called Grubhub and restaurant simultaneously and both put us on hold to get their stories straight; the "manager" shows up with the food while on hold (shocker), restaurant says they called me five times, manager shows up with wrong number called twice AFTER both of my calls, and more lip service... now I have no dinner and need to wait five business days for a refund... shame on you. Lie about using grubhub, then use your own employees to upcharge, then don't show up. Male answering the phone told me "I'm busy right now," and didn't want to be bothered with our calls... wonderful. We have hungry kids. Thanks a lot. Steer clear unless you want to pick your own food up. These people are dishonest and now I wait more than a week for my refund. Shame on you guys.

Was out running around and had a craving for Thai food. As always I went to my Yelp app to see what was around. Gaati came right up and was only .2 miles away so off we went.   Kayba greeted us as soon as walked in. We told her it was our first time there so she gave us two menus to look at the lunch specials. She answered several questions for us and explained the dishes.   The lunch special is $9 which includes salad with ginger dressing, tom yum soup, a curry puff and main course. You can choose from beef, chicken, vegetable or tofu and then what type of entree you want. There were many options: Pad thai, mongolian, sweet & sour, panang, green curry, yellow and red curry.   We chose the chicken pad thai and chicken yellow curry. Kayba brought out our salad and soup which I thought were very good. The salad was a little sparse with just some lettuce and carrots but the ginger dressing was great.   Shortly after our entrees arrived. I am not a Thai food expert but I really enjoyed my pad thai, the sauce was delicious. Kayba came by to make sure we liked everything and to refill our drinks. She was very friendly and helpful to first timers.   I thought the food and service were great, and for $9 we were full and happy.

Delivery man was very nice. Easy ordering over the phone the woman repeated everything back for us.  The food tasted homemade and not greasy like typical Thai restaurants around here. I'm not much on fried rice but my husbands BBQ fried rice was amazingly addictive. They would've gotten five stars if we got fortune cookies ;) I don't think this is that sorta place! Def our new spot
Go there! Wonderful food and service, authentic Thai food and very reasonable prices. I was lucky enough to wander in while in town visiting friends. If you like Thai, go. Enough said.

We visited this restaurant for the first time just now and found the food to be flavorful and good. We eat Thai allot and I like this place. We had the treasures for an appetizer, the yellow curry with chicken and the cashew chicken for entree's and everything was good including the free scoop of ice cream we were offered at the end of the meal along with the service.
We came in on a Monday it wasn't too busy ordered yellow curry and volcano chicken it was delicious!! Must try !! Also the Thai teas have a great flavor to them.
